Authors:
Tetsuhiro Matsuzawa, Galba Maria Campos Takaki, Takashi
Yaguchi, Kaoru Okada, Paride Abliz, Tohru Gonoi, Yoshikazu Horie
Title:
Aspergillus arcoverdensis, a new species of Aspergillus
section Fumigati isolated from caatinga soil in Pernembuco state,
Brazil
Abstract:
Aspergillus arcoverdensis, a new Aspergillus isolated from
semi-desert soil in caatinga area, State of Pernambuco, Brazil, are
described and illustrated. Aspergillus arcoverdensis is characterized by
its, relatively long conidiophores in Aspergillus section Fumigati, and
subglobose to broadly elliptical and smooth conidia. The validation of
this new species is supported further by analyses of the Î²-tubulin,
calmodulin and actin gene sequences.
